title: Shape of a Bar Graph
question_text:
A researcher was interested in information regarding post-traumatic seizures (PTS) among patients who have suffered from a traumatic brain injury (TBI). She surveyed a variety of ages and asked the subjects if they have suffered from a post-traumatic seizure. The results in the following graph below.
Delldot. A bar graph showing the risk of post traumatic seizures by age group. Digital image. Wikimedia Commons. N.p., 3 Mar. 2008. Web. 7 Mar. 2016.

How could one describe the shape of this graph?

choices.text: Unable to tell since not all age groups were surveyed.
Unable to tell since the variables are categorical.

solution:
While age typically is described as a quantitative variable, in the context of this graph age is grouped into categorical variables of "under 7", "7 to 16", and "over 16".

One cannot determine shape in this case because the age groups are not divided equally; rather they are divided into predetermined values given in the graph. Therefore, Choices 'A', 'B', and 'C' are incorrect.

Choice 'D' is also incorrect. It is unclear whether all age groups were surveyed or not by the description of the problem. However, this fact does not matter since the age groups were broken into categories of non equal age groups in the graph displayed.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
